data.en: Before my bed there is bright moonlight
So that it seems like frost on the ground
Lifting my head I watch the bright moon
Lowering my head I dream that I’m home

data.vi: Đầu giường chợt thấy bóng trăng
data.en: Before my bed there is bright moonlight

data.vi: Mập mờ trên đất, ngỡ rằng sương sa
data.en: So that it seems like frost on the ground

data.vi: Ngửng đầu trông vẻ gương nga
data.en: Lifting my head I watch the bright moon

data.vi: Cúi đầu luống những nhớ nhà băn khoăn
data.en: Lowering my head I dream that I’m home
Look there

data.vi: Hoàng hà chi thủy thiên thượng lai
data.en: The waters of the Yellow River, coming down from Heaven

data.vi: Bôn lưu đáo hải bất phục hồi
data.en: Rush in their flow to the sea, never turn back again
Look there

data.vi: Cao đường minh kính bi bạch phát
data.en: Bright in the mirrors of mighty halls a grieving for white hair

data.vi: Triêu như thanh ty mộ thành tuyết
data.en: This morning blue-black strands of silk, now turned to snow with evening

data.vi: Nhân sinh đắc ý tu tận hoan
data.en: For satisfaction in this life taste pleasure to the limit

data.vi: Mạc sử kim tôn không đối nguyệt
data.en: And never let a goblet of gold face the bright moon empty
Green mountains lie across the northern outskirts of the city
White water Winds around the eastern city wall
Once we make our parting here in this place
Like a solitary tumbleweed you will go ten thousand miles
Floating clouds are the thoughts of the wanderer
Setting sun is the mood of his old friend
Now you go from here
Your horse gives a whinny, as it departs
Green
White
Mountain
Water
Outskirts
City
Lie across
Here among flowers one flask of wine
With no close friends, I pour it alone
I lift cup to bright moon, beg its company,
then facing my shadow, we became three
The moon has never known how to drink,
my shadow does nothing but follow me
But with moon and shadow as companions the while,
this joy I find must catch spring while it’s here
I sing, and the moon just lingers on,
I dance, and my shadow flails wildly
When still sober we share friendship and pleasure,
then, utterly drunk, each goes his own way
Let us join to roam beyond human cares
And plan to meet far in the river of stars
